element.name: Conjure Furniture
element.source: Hex's Notes on Magic and Combat

description.p: You can conjure 1 piece of furniture fit for the caster along with related items (cushions, sheets, etc) in unoccupied space within range for the duration.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three instances active at a time, and you can dismiss each as an action.
The conjured furniture and related items can be made of typical materials but will not protect against harsh weather or excessive damage.

element.name: Trebuchet
element.source: Hex's Notes on Magic and Combat
element.supports: Sorcerer, Wizard, Artificer, Spell Saving Throw

description.p: Choose one object weighing 1 to 200 pounds within range that isnâ€™t being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 1000 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take 10d8 bludgeoning damage
